Built for Compliance Officers, Risk Managers, Security Architects, SOC Analysts, and IT Administrators, this workbook enables you to monitor resilience controls, track incidents, map security signals to DORA Articles, and simplify evidence collection for audits.
<br><br>
This workbook includes pre-built KQL queries aligned with key DORA themes—ICT Risk Management, Incident Reporting, Threat Intelligence, Business Continuity, and Audit & Oversight. These queries can be exported or extended to support deeper investigations, operational reviews, or regulatory assessments.
<br><br>
The Microsoft Sentinel team welcomes your feedback on this DORA Compliance Solution, including suggestions for additional mappings or automation to further strengthen your organization’s operational resilience obligations. Please share your feedback with us [Here](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=v4j5cvGGr0GRqy180BHbR5vpbw39GIlPr6oh7FnjxTFUOVhBOFowTFlaT1pOSTAxVDdRT1pIUDlINy4u) .","style":"info"},"name":"text - 7"},{"type":1,"content":{"json":"### Getting Started with the DORA Compliance Solution

The DORA compliance report in Microsoft Sentinel helps financial institutions and service providers assess and validate adherence to the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA). It provides visibility into ICT risk management, incident reporting, resilience measures, and continuity controls across critical infrastructure and digital services.

Use the dashboard to:

 - Monitor disruptions and security incidents mapped to DORA Articles
 - Evaluate threat intelligence activity
 - Ensure continuity and recovery mechanisms are effective


The solution also supports streamlined audit preparation, evidence collection, and integration with Azure services to strengthen overall digital operational resilience.

Pre-requisites to get started:<br>

1. **<u>Connect Data Sources:</u>**  
   Connect applicable data sources to populate reports. Supported data sources include:</br>
<u>Note: Install Sentinel solutions using the links below for each data source. After installation, configure their data connectors (skip if already done).</u></br>
   - ***SecurityEvent / SecurityAlert / SecurityIncident*** (Windows server event logs — login activity, access attempts, anomaly and incident detection). Links :  [Install Microsoft Defender for Cloud](https://portal.azure.com/#view/Microsoft_Azure_Marketplace/GalleryItemDetailsBladeNopdl/id/azuresentinel.azure-sentinel-solution-microsoftdefenderforcloud), [Install Microsoft Defender for Office 365](https://portal.azure.com/#view/Microsoft_Azure_Marketplace/GalleryItemDetailsBladeNopdl/id/azuresentinel.azure-sentinel-solution-microsoftdefenderforo365) ,[Install Microsoft Defender XDR](https://portal.azure.com/#view/Microsoft_Azure_Marketplace/GalleryItemDetailsBladeNopdl/id/azuresentinel.azure-sentinel-solution-microsoft365defender) and [Install Microsoft Defender for Endpoint](https://portal.azure.com/#view/Microsoft_Azure_Marketplace/GalleryItemDetailsBladeNopdl/id/azuresentinel.azure-sentinel-solution-microsoftdefenderendpoint)
   - ***Event/SecurityEvent*** (for fetching latest security events). Link : [Install Windows Security Events via AMA](https://portal.azure.com/#view/Microsoft_Azure_Marketplace/GalleryItemDetailsBladeNopdl/id/azuresentinel.azure-sentinel-solution-securityevents)
   - ***ThreatIntelIndicators*** (for fetching latest threatID's). Link : [Install Threat Intel](https://portal.azure.com/#view/Microsoft_Azure_Marketplace/GalleryItemDetailsBladeNopdl/id/azuresentinel.azure-sentinel-solution-threatintelligence-updated)<br>

2. **<u>Define DORA Assets:</u>**<br>
   Define DORA-relevant assets within your compliance scope using a Watchlist:<br><br>

   **<u>DORA Assets Watchlist</u>**  
   - Save a CSV file with the following columns: `DeviceName, DeviceType`
   - Repeat same steps as above but use:
     - **Name:** `dora_assets`
     - **Alias:** `dora_assets`
     - **SearchKey:** `DeviceName`  
<br>

### Included in the Microsoft Sentinel DORA Compliance Solution

This solution enables Microsoft Sentinel users to leverage SIEM capabilities to meet DORA requirements, including resilience monitoring, incident reporting, threat intelligence integration, and business continuity oversight.<br>

The included Watchlist allows users to define assets within their compliance scope.<br>
The Workbook contains four tabs with dashboards, visualizations, and reports for immediate insights into your DORA environment:<br>

**<u>Incident Management & Reporting</u>**  
Provides visibility into incident severity, resolution time, SLA adherence, and analyst workload:  

1. **Mean Time to Resolve (MTTR):** Average resolution time for incidents.
2. **Incidents by Severity:** Breakdown by severity (High, Medium, Low). 
3. **Open Incidents by Owner:** Active incidents grouped by owner.
4. **Top Incident Categories:** Common incident types (malware, phishing, identity compromise, misconfigurations). 
5. **Time Taken to Resolve the Incidents:** Highlights slow investigations and outliers.
6. **SLA Breach – Incidents Unresolved Beyond 72 Hours:** Lists unresolved incidents past SLA threshold.  
<br>

**<u>Threat Intelligence & Detection</u>**  
This tab provides a unified view of threat indicators, adversary behaviors, and detection activity across your environment. It helps analysts correlate real-time IOCs with security alerts, understand attacker tactics using MITRE ATT&CK, identify prevented attacks, and prioritize threats based on confidence and activity levels. This tab strengthens proactive defense by combining threat intelligence with Sentinel’s detection capabilities to surface the most relevant and high-risk threats for investigation.

1. **Active Threat Indicators (IOC Hits):** Displays all active indicators of compromise (IOCs) that matched with your environment, showing which endpoints or resources communicated with malicious IPs/domains.
2. **Alerts by MITRE ATT&CK Techniques:** Shows all security alerts categorized by MITRE ATT&CK techniques (e.g., Initial Access, Credential Access, Lateral Movement).
3. **Failed Attack Attempts (Prevented by Control):** Highlights attacks that were attempted but successfully blocked by security controls (e.g., firewall blocks, Defender real-time protection, policy enforcement).
4. **Malicious File or URL Detection:** Displays detections related to malicious files, URLs, email links, or attachments identified by your security solutions.
4. **Focus on Indicators with High Confidence and Activity:** Surfaces IOCs with both high confidence (validated, reliable intelligence) and high activity (multiple hits or detections).<br>

**<u>Business Continuity & Recovery</u>**  
Provides visibility into the operational health of critical infrastructure and the effectiveness of your continuity mechanisms. It helps teams identify inactive or unreachable systems, monitor failover patterns, and track recovery behavior across servers, clusters, and backup sites:

1. **Inactive Servers / Devices:** This panel displays servers or devices that have stopped sending heartbeats or logs within the expected time window..
2. **Trend of Failover, Cluster Switch, or Backup Site Activation:** It provides insights into whether failover events are expected (planned maintenance) or abnormal (service disruption). <br>

**<u>Compliance Mapping & Evidence</u>**  
Provides a centralized view of how security alerts, threat intelligence signals, and operational activities align with key DORA regulatory requirements. It helps compliance teams visualize control coverage, track monthly compliance trends, and review evidence that supports regulatory assessments and audits. This tab strengthens operational resilience by ensuring that alerts and threats are mapped to the appropriate DORA Articles, enabling accurate reporting, continuous monitoring, and easier audit preparation.:

1. **Alerts per Compliance Control Mapping:** Displays security alerts categorized based on their mapped DORA controls or Articles.
2. **Monthly Compliance Summary:** Presents month-over-month tracking of compliance-related activity, including alerts, mapped controls, and evidence logs.
3. **DORA Mapping by Threat Type (from Threat Intel Reports)** Correlates threat intelligence categories (e.g., malware, phishing, credential theft, APT activity) with relevant DORA Articles and requirements.
